column2: Frodo]] and his companions were spending their night with the Elves in the woods of [[the Shire]]; the Elves burst into song as Menelvagor, the [[Swordsman of the Sky]], appeared in the sky.<ref>{{FR

column1: The name is a direct calque of the constellation's [[Quenya]] name [[Menelmacar]], "Swordsman of the Sky".<ref>{{LR

The constellation entered into the story only in the latest phases of its composition. In earlier versions of the manuscript of'' [[The Lord of the Rings]]'' the Elves begun to sing as 'the yellow moon rose',<ref>{{HM
column2: RS}} (p. 61)</ref> and in a later revision 'in the East the thin silver rind of the New Moon appeared'<ref>{{HM
column3: RS}} (p. 325)</ref> due to Tolkien's calculations considering the phases of the Moon;<ref>{{HM
column4: RS}} (cf. p. 434)</ref> still there was a fault: the Moon would not have risen from the East at that time of the year;<ref>{{HM
column5: RS}} (p. 325)</ref> thus the Moon was finally changed to the apparition of Menelvagor and other [[stars]].
